p: The Caucasus region with its remarkable biodiversity (it is designated as one of the biodiversity hotspots [ 38]) is a source of a few invasive plants over the world that include prominent species such as Heracleum sosnowskyi Manden., H. mantegazzianum Sommier & Levier, Rubus armeniacus Focke, Veronica filiformis Sm. or Rhaponticum repens (L.) Hidalgo [ 39][ http://www.iucngisd.org/gisd/]. They were transported either accidentally or on purpose, as in the case of H. sosnowskyi and H. mantegazzianum, which were incorrectly considered potentially valuable herbs providing higher yields of forage from meadows [ 40].
